meanings.definition: Facing outward or away from the axis.
meanings.sent1: The extrorse petals of the flower were beautifully visible.
meanings.sent2: The plant's extrorse leaves reached towards the sunlight.
meanings.sent3: The extrorse branches seemed to be waving goodbye to the wind.
meanings.sent4: Her extrorse personality always shone brightly in social gatherings.
meanings.sent5: The extrorse design of the building made it stand out among the rest.

meanings.definition: Directed outward or away from the center.
meanings.sent1: The extrorse arrows pointed towards the distant target.
meanings.sent2: The extrorse rays of the sun illuminated the entire room.
meanings.sent3: The extrorse road signs guided travelers on their journey.
meanings.sent4: His extrorse thoughts always led him to explore new horizons.
meanings.sent5: The extrorse gaze of the statue seemed to watch over the town.

meanings.sent1: The extrorse handle of the door made it easy to pull open.
meanings.sent2: The extrorse branches of the tree extended towards the sky.
meanings.sent3: The extrorse wind blew the leaves in all directions.
meanings.sent4: Her extrorse smile brightened up the room instantly.
meanings.sent5: The extrorse design of the garden allowed visitors to enjoy the view.
